./Job-Context/PDF's/NDA - Robert Balch I:
Non-Solicitation and Confidentiality Agreement
I, Robert Balch II, understand that I am being retained in a position of trust and confidence and
will have access to and become familiar with the methods, services, and procedures used
by Abrazo Technologies, LLC (“Abrazo”). As part of my duties, I also may develop and maintain
close working relationships with Abrazo's clients.
Abrazo's business involves providing IT services to its existing and prospective
customers. Abrazo, its employees, and contractors may often have access to confidential
information about Abrazo's clients' business. Abrazo's technology, processes, and client base
are valuable and unique assets of Abrazo's business. I understand that Abrazo views its list of
clients, including clients it will add in the course of our work together and its prospective clients
that it has begun marketing to, as confidential information that should not be disclosed to
persons outside Abrazo's organization or be used by me for my own or anyone else's benefit,
other than Abrazo.
Abrazo's business would be seriously harmed by the unauthorized disclosure of its confidential
information, its clients' confidential information, or the unauthorized use of any such
information. Abrazo would be similarly harmed if I solicit its clients, prospective clients and
employees. The monetary harm of any of these things occurring may be difficult, if not
impossible, to measure.
Therefore, in consideration for my continued opportunity to work as a contractor for Abrazo,
Abrazo and I agree, as follows:
Agreement To Maintain Confidential Information
1. “Confidential Information” means any information not generally known by third parties,
including Abrazo's competitors or the general public, whether or not expressly identified
as confidential. “Confidential information” includes information about Abrazo's software,
software source codes (including software and source codes for products in
development), trade secrets, proprietary technology, marketing information, sales
information, training materials, data processing, internet or intranet services, strategic
plans, compensation, and finances. It also includes information about Abrazo's clients
and potential clients, including their identities and their business practices.
2. I will not, during or after my employment as a contractor for Abrazo, disclose Abrazo's
Confidential Information (including its clients' information) to any other person or entity,
or use Abrazo's Confidential Information for my own benefit or for the benefit of another,
unless Abrazo has expressly authorized me to do so in writing. This includes all
information or types of information that I know or have reason to know that Abrazo or its
clients intend to keep confidential.
3. If either Abrazo or I terminate my employment as a contractor, I will deliver to Abrazo
within 24 hours all of Abrazo's property, including computers, cell phones, technology,
originals and copies regardless of form (such paper, computer or electronic). This
includes all materials related to my employment including all software, source codes,
product development information, business forms, client lists, financial information,
training materials, or client information.
Nonsolicitation Agreement
Non-Solicitation and Confidentiality Agreement
4. For a period of one year after the termination of my work for Abrazo, I will not without the
express written approval of Abrazo, directly or indirectly solicit any
a. past customer of Abrazo with whom I had contact through Abrazo,
b. past customer of Abrazo who worked with Abrazo while I was performing work
for Abrazo,
c. any then-current Abrazo customer,
d. or any prospective customer that is being actively marketed by Abrazo at the
time my work for Abrazo terminates.
5. I will not, during the term of my work for Abrazo, or for a period of one year after the
termination of my work, directly or indirectly solicit any of Abrazo's employees or
independent contractors for the purpose of hiring them or inducing them to leave their
position with Abrazo.
6. The date of “termination of my work” with Abrazo will be determined by the date that
Abrazo provides me with written notice that our relationship has ended.
Intellectual Property Ownership
7. I agree that all copyrights, patents, patentable material, trade secrets, trademarks or
other intellectual property rights associated with any ideas, concepts, techniques,
inventions, processes, or works of authorship developed or created by me during the
course of performing work for or on behalf of Abrazo (collectively, the “Work Product”)
will belong exclusively to Abrazo and will, to the extent possible, be considered a “work
made for hire” as that term is defined in Title 17 of the United States Code. I agree to
automatically assign, at the time of creation of the Work Product, without any
requirement of further consideration, any right, title, or interest I may have in such Work
Product, including any copyrights, patents, patentable material, trade secrets,
trademarks or other intellectual property rights pertaining thereto. Upon request
of Abrazo, I will take such further actions, including execution and delivery of instruments
of conveyance, as may be appropriate to give full and proper effect to such
assignment(s). During my employment with Abrazo, I will promptly disclose
to Abrazo any such Work Product in writing.
Remedies
8. If I violate this Agreement, Abrazo may seek injunctive relief and/or any other remedy
allowed by law and collect from me reasonable attorneys' fees and costs incurred in
enforcing the terms of this Agreement. I also agree that I will repay all profits,
compensation, commissions or other benefits which I have realized as a result of my
violation, and that I will permit an individual of Abrazo's choosing to conduct an audit for
that purpose.
9. This Agreement shall be interpreted according to the laws of the State of New
Mexico without regard to choice of law principles. Any action regarding this Agreement
shall venue in the state or federal courts of New Mexico. If a court rules that any part of
this Agreement is not enforceable, that part may be modified by the court to make it
enforceable or it may be severed and the other parts of the Agreement that shall remain
enforceable.
Non-Solicitation and Confidentiality Agreement
10. Abrazo's action in not enforcing a breach of any part of this Agreement shall not
prevent Abrazo from enforcing it as to any other breach of this Agreement
that Abrazo discovers.
11. This Agreement incorporates our entire understanding about its subjects. This
Agreement may not be canceled or modified except by another written agreement
signed by me and by Abrazo's authorized officer.
12. I understand that this Agreement does not change my status as an independent
contractor of Abrazo. I agree and understand that either I or Abrazo may terminate my
work relationship at any time and for any lawful reason, with or without notice.
Dated: 6/26/2025

ABRAZO Technologies, LLC

./Job-Context/PDF's/Professional Referen:
To Whom It May Concern,
Subject: Professional Reference for Robert Balch II
I am writing to provide a professional reference for Robert Balch II, with whom I had the pleasure of
working at Dash2 Labs. During his tenure, Robert demonstrated exceptional skills and dedication,
particularly in projects involving MongoDB, Python, and Webpack.
Key Contributions
● Space Valley Project: Enhanced data visualization for the chatbot on the SpaceValley website.
Integrated natural language processing to improve the chatbot's interaction. Developed
middleware API endpoints to support the project's needs. Validated script consistency to ensure
streamlined testing.
● SpaceValley Website Rebuild: Developed React components and upgraded the project to
enhance the developer experience.
Overall Assessment
Robert's technical expertise, combined with his ability to work collaboratively and his commitment to
excellence, make him an outstanding candidate for any role he pursues. I am confident that he will
continue to excel and make significant contributions in his future endeavors.
Please feel free to contact me if you require any further information.
Best regards,
Dustin
Vice President of Software

Summary
3+ years as a JavaScript developer, specializing in robust web applications and advanced NLP-driven
data visualization with python. Strong in data analysis, growing in data modeling. I am particularly
proficient in Next.js, Adonis.js, Flask.py, Docker, and PostgreSQL. I have a proven track record in project
completion and am passionate about optimizing tech processes and efficiency.
Skills and Toolkit
● Languages: JavaScript/ECMAScript (ES6), TypeScript, PHP, HTML5, CSS-vanilla, Python ,Python3,
PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite
● Frontend Technologies: Wordpress, Node.js, Vite.js, Webpack.js, Redux.js, Remix.js, React-Router.js,
React.js, Bootstrap.js, React-Bootstrap, Next.js, TailwindCSS, Flask.py, Django.py

● Operating Systems: Ubuntu/Debian, Fedora, Arch Linux, Alpine Linux, WSL2, Windows 10 & 11, OSX
● Development Tools: VSCode IDE, WebStorm IDE, Windsurf IDE, Cursor IDE, Void IDE, Warp Terminal,
Wave Terminal, Docker Desktop/CLI, Kubernetes, Postman, Insomnia
● Project Management Tools: Microsoft ecosystem tools, Google ecosystem tools, Github Version
Control, Git, Jira, CodeBase, Miro

6/26/2025
Dear Liftoff Hiring Team,
I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Senior Data Engineer position at Liftoff. As
a developer with a passion for civic technology and a recent focus on data science, I was
immediately drawn to this unique opportunity to build data-driven products that advance
Democratic priorities.
The role described is a perfect match for my skillset, which sits at the intersection of data
engineering and front-end development. My professional experience has been centered on
building robust web applications with Python and JavaScript, while my recent intensive Data
Science certification has equipped me with strong skills in data modeling, ETL/ELT pipelines,
and building automated workflows.
In my recent work, I have:
● Engineered data pipelines to process and model complex datasets for analysis, using
Python, postgreSQL, and predictive modeling techniques.
● Developed full-stack applications using React, demonstrating my ability to build the
modern, intuitive interfaces you require.
● Designed and managed PostgreSQL databases, giving me a strong foundation in data
modeling and query optimization that I am eager to apply to a system like BigQuery.
● Built a natural language interface for a chatbot using Python and LangChain,
showcasing my ability to work with APIs and develop automated, self-service tools.
While I have not yet used dbt in a professional capacity, I am a quick study with new
technologies and my deep understanding of data transformation and modeling makes me
confident I can ramp up swiftly. My passion for this work is not just professional; it's personal.
My active participation in local movements for racial justice and my support for progressive
campaigns have solidified my commitment to using my technical skills for mission-driven work.
I am excited by the challenge of developing powerful tools to elect Democrats and drive
progressive change. My resume is attached for your review, and I look forward to discussing
how my experience can contribute to the important work at Liftoff.
Thank you for your time and consideration.
Best regards,
Robert Balch II
